results.title: The Effects of NT-1044, a Novel AMPK Activator, on Endometrial Cancer Cell Proliferation, Apoptosis, Cell Stress and In Vivo Tumor Growth
results.text_hl: @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@Anti-diabetic biguanide@@@ drugs such as @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ may have anti-@<m>DISEASE_Cell_Transformation_Neoplastic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002471 @@@tumorigenic@@@ effects by behaving as @GENE_PRKAA2 @GENE_5563 @@@AMPK@@@ activators and @GENE_MTOR @GENE_2475 @@@mTOR@@@ inhibitors.

results.title: Metformin Lysosomal Targeting: A Novel Aspect to Be Investigated for Metformin Repurposing in Neurodegenerative Diseases?
results.text_hl: In addition to warranting good short- and long-term glycemic control, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ displays many intriguing properties as protection against @DISEASE_Neurodegenerative_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D019636 @@@cardiovascular and neurodegenerative diseases@@@, anti-@<m>DISEASE_Cell_Transformation_Neoplastic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002471 @@@tumorigenic@@@ and longevity promotion.

citations.NLM: Papini N, Giussani P, Tringali C. Metformin Lysosomal Targeting: A Novel Aspect to Be Investigated for Metformin Repurposing in Neurodegenerative Diseases? Int J Mol Sci. 2024 Aug 15;25(16):. PMID: 39201569

results.title: Synergy between sublethal doses of shikonin and metformin fully inhibits breast cancer cell migration and reverses epithelial-mesenchymal transition.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSIONS: @CHEMICAL_shikonin @CHEMICAL_MESH:C016101 @@@Shikonin@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ synergize in inhibiting the @<m>DISEASE_Cell_Transformation_Neoplastic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002471 @@@tumorigenic@@@ activities of @CELLLINE_CVCL:0031 @@@MCF-7@@@ cells including their proliferation, invasiveness, and EMT with a potential to inhibit multidrug resistance.

citations.NLM: Tabari AR, Gavidel P, Sabouni F, Gardaneh M. Synergy between sublethal doses of shikonin and metformin fully inhibits breast cancer cell migration and reverses epithelial-mesenchymal transition. Mol Biol Rep. 2022 Jun;49(6):4307-4319. PMID: 35525887

results.title: Metformin inhibits neutrophil extracellular traps-promoted pancreatic carcinogenesis in obese mice.
results.text_hl: The latter could induce an @DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory@@@ response in ductal cells via @GENE_TLR4 @GENE_21898 @@@TLR4@@@-dependent pathways both in vivo and vitro, as demonstrated by upregulation of @GENE_IL1B @GENE_16176 @@@IL-1beta@@@. @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ and @GENE_DNASE1 @GENE_13419 @@@DNase I@@@ significantly reversed the pro-@<m>DISEASE_Cell_Transformation_Neoplastic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002471 @@@tumorigenic@@@ effects of @DISEASE_Obesity @DISEASE_MESH:D009765 @@@obesity@@@ and @DISEASE_Periodic_fever_familial_autosomal_dominant @DISEASE_MESH:C536657 @@@NETs@@@ in vivo and in vitro.

citations.NLM: Wang G, Gao H, Dai S, Li M, Gao Y, Yin L, Zhang K, Zhang J, Jiang K, Miao Y, Lu Z. Metformin inhibits neutrophil extracellular traps-promoted pancreatic carcinogenesis in obese mice. Cancer Lett. 2023 May 28;562():216155. PMID: 37030634

results.title: Metformin in Overcoming Enzalutamide Resistance in Castration-Resistant Prostate Cancer.
results.text_hl: This highlights the necessity for developing novel therapeutic targets to combat the gain of resistance. @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ has been recently investigated for its potential anti-@<m>DISEASE_Cell_Transformation_Neoplastic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002471 @@@tumorigenic@@@ effects in many @DISEASE_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@cancer@@@ types.

results.title: Metformin Dysregulates the Unfolded Protein Response and the WNT/beta-Catenin Pathway in Endometrial Cancer Cells through an AMPK-Independent Mechanism
results.text_hl: Multiple lines of evidence suggest that @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, an antidiabetic drug, exerts anti-@<m>DISEASE_Cell_Transformation_Neoplastic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002471 @@@tumorigenic@@@ effects in different types of @DISEASE_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@cancer@@@.

results.title: Modulation of M1 and M2 macrophage polarization by metformin: Implications for inflammatory diseases and malignant tumors.
results.text_hl: In addition to antidiabetic impacts, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ also possesses multiple biological activities, including immunomodulatory, anti-@DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory@@@, anti-@<m>DISEASE_Cell_Transformation_Neoplastic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002471 @@@tumorigenic@@@, anti-aging, cardioprotective, hepatoprotective, and tissue-regenerative properties.

citations.NLM: Jafarzadeh S, Nemati M, Zandvakili R, Jafarzadeh A. Modulation of M1 and M2 macrophage polarization by metformin: Implications for inflammatory diseases and malignant tumors. Int Immunopharmacol. 2025 Mar 1;151():114345. PMID: 40024215
